headline: Instant Pot Chicken and Dumplings
description: This Instant Pot chicken and dumplings is a rich stew filled with carrots, peas, green beans, and onions topped with fluffy buttermilk drop biscuits.

video.description: This classic Southern dish is so easy in an Instant Pot!
video.name: Instant Pot Chicken and Dumplings

name: Instant Pot Chicken and Dumplings
recipeIngredient: 1 pound bone-in chicken breasts, skin removed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Pour olive oil into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot) and select the SautÃ© function. Cook and stir onion, carrot, celery, and bay leaf until vegetables are soft and onion has turned translucent, about 5 minutes.

Add chicken broth, thighs, breasts, salt, thyme, marjoram, and black pepper. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 9 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Carefully use tongs to remove chicken pieces to a large bowl to cool slightly; discard bay leaf.
While chicken is cooling, mash butter with flour in a small bowl to make a smooth paste; set aside.

Make dumplings: Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture resembles the texture of cornmeal. Stir in parsley and set aside.

Shred cooled chicken and return to the pot. Taste broth and season with salt and pepper if needed. Add peas and green beans. Stir in flour-butter paste until incorporated. Select SautÃ© function and bring broth to a boil.
Pour buttermilk into dumpling mixture and stir until combined. Drop dough by heaping spoonfuls over the top of stew.
Close the lid, leaving the steam vent open. Select Slow Cooker function and simmer on Low, covered, until a skewer inserted into the center of a dumpling comes out clean, 10 to 12 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It was so good and filling!
I like dumplings very nice yes I added a bacon cooked and chopped was absolutely delicious thank you ðŸ’šðŸŒ»
Easy to make, tasted great!
Easy. Delicious. I deleted beans and peas and put potatoes instead. Dumplings easy. Big hit!!!

Had boiled ch bones to make the broth. Had used leftover chicken from the freezer. R. really liked the dumplings. The dumplings took longer than instructed, but I might not have had the broth boiling enough before putting on "slow cooker" mode.
Amazing!

This was fantastic!! I already had cooked the chicken thighs so I didnâ€™t use the instant pot to cook the chicken. At that step, I put the shredded chicken into the pot with the liquid and seasonings and set it to high pressure for 3 minutes to get it boiling. Then followed the rest of the directions. I did add a little more chicken stock after it was cooked as it seemed too thick. But my family LOVED it!! Will definitely be making this again.
Good basic recipe but lacked seasoning and was very bland as-is. Next time, I would add a lot more herbs and spices as well as more salt.

Iâ€™ve made this at least a dozen times now over the past year. Itâ€™s a family favorite. I tweak it for our family by omitting the chicken breasts (it was too much meat for us & the thighs taste better), increasing the dumpling recipe by 50%, and I sometimes sub corn for the green beans. Itâ€™s amazing!

I loved this recipe but I did make some changes. I like thighs so I used only thighs with bone in. I thought the sauce should be thicker so I doubled the flour and butter and next time I will triple the flour. But the best thing I did was follow another suggestion and that is to pressure the dumplings for 10 minutes on low. It worked so well. Otherwise I had to pour out the stew into another pan and cook the dumplings on top of the stew on the stove. I'm not going there again.
I thought the dumplings would be light an fluffy. The chicken stew was wonderful, just need to find a different dumpling recipe.

Great recipe. Made it as written except where I had to substitute. Fresh marjoram and thyme versus dried, only needed two medium chicken breasts (plenty of meat), and half & half (with 2 tsp of dried buttermilk mix) substituted for the buttermilk for the dumplings.
As others mentioned, set the Instant Pot to saute for the dumplings, but set to low as it will start burning the bottom. 12 minutes lid on and another 5 off.
Will do this recipe again.
My family loved it! I made half again the biscuit dough because it didn't seem like it was going to make very much and it was the perfect amount. We even have a little left over for tomorrow.
very good. make again. doubled all the vegetables

We plan to make this again next weekend. I didn't have marjoram, so I subbed in savory. Soup is perfect for a cold winter's day, but there is a flaw in the recipe instructions. The last instruction to put your cooker on 'slow cook' will not work to cook the dumplings, the heat is way too low. Instead, leave your cooker on saute and just let the dumplings cook in the boiling/simmering liquid for about 15 mins.

I loved the simplicity of this soup yet delivers a powerful flavorful punch. What I used to make the dough was the red lobster cheddar biscuit mix. I followed the box instructions. To my soup I added cabbage but you don't have to as well as cilantro. Again these two extra ingredients are just extras the soup is delicious without them.

Itâ€™s pretty good! And the directions were perfect and spot on. The soup is thick like chicken pot pie, just like the profile stated. A brilliant idea to use bone-in for the dark and white meat. It gives the soup a flavor profile that you just wonâ€™t attain with boneless poultry. I didnâ€™t make any major modifications, only small preference changes. Like I added garlic and instead of using butter for the flour paste, I just skimmed the chicken fat from the broth after it was done cooking.
This was amazing! I've never had chicken and dumplings before. It was easy and so tasty. Thanks!

This was a bit more work than I initially realized, but well worth the effort! I only used about 1 pound of chicken breast (omitted the thighs) and felt like it was plenty of meat. I'll definitely be making it again this winter!
Very easy, dropped the peas and beans for personal taste. Great on a Fall or Winter day!

Soup was delicious! I used less marjoram and added a little oregano, basil, and poultry seasoning. The dumplings were not perfect, but that was likely my fault because I put 3 TBS of butter instead of 2.

Followed recipe exactly. As others noted not all ingredients are listed. I watched the video and that filled in the blanks. I could also see in the video that the end result was more like soup so I added corn starch to give it more a pot pie thickness. There were no leftovers. Will definitely make again and add more veg next time.

This was very good and we will have it again! I didn't have any celery on hand, so I added some celery salt to it but then didn't add the salt that it was calling for. I did add the salt to the dumpling mixture. I also added a 1/2 teaspoon of poultry seasoning, 1 cup of water and 4 chicken bouillon cubes. Turned out simply wonderful!!
OMG! This was amazing. My husband loved it as well. I really didn't change a thing. The directions were spot on. Great fall meal. Thanks for the recipe.
Full of flavor. My kids even ate the veggies! Its filling and definitely a comfort food. Thank you for the recipe!
Been looking for a good chicken and dumpling recipe for years. This definitely fit the bill!
Turned out perfect!
This is absolutely delicious! Would not change one thing. I love chicken and dumplings and this recipe is the best I have ever tasted. TY for sharing.

Very good, I used chicken thighs w/ bones only . I skinned them, and fried the skin up with the olive oil and veggies then removed them. I made the dumplings from bisque and added a little dried rosemary. 
Came out really good!

Very good! No changes other than I wish I would have seen to reduce the liquid for a pot pie style. Kind of a duh! moment but I am new to cooking with the instant pot and I donâ€™t cook that often in general. Will try reducing the broth next time :)

Flavorful, satisfying dish. I did find the dumplings time estimate was too short. Prep time estimate was right on. Overall, a fairly easy, not too involved recipe that was delicious comfort food. Will definitely make again.

Delicious but would have been better if I had Marjoram. Putting it on the grocery list now! So, I added 1/4 tsp thyme and 2 strong shakes of garlic powder. My husband enjoyed it so it.must have been really good!

This was so delicious! The only thing I did different was add 3 cloves of minced garlic because everything is better with garlic, 1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper, and corn instead of green beans because thats what I had on hand. Everything else I followed. My husband loves chicken and dumplings and this was his favorite out of other receipes.

I can't believe how good this was! Easy to make and full of flavor. Great addition to the Instant Pot recipes.
Thanks!
Loved it! Everything went as directed. Will make again!
Oh my this is so good! First try making it with the Instapot and it turned out perfect! This is a keeper recipe, my family loved it.
The dumplings have an amazing flavor!

Excellent recipe! Really enjoyed the flavors of all the recommended spices. The only thing I changed was that I only used chicken breasts and skipped the thighs. Definitely will make this again as the family really enjoyed it!
I tried this recipe because I wanted to use my Instant Pot. Well, everyone loved it! This recipe is a keeper.

Excellent comfort dish! I used left over chicken breast that had been grilled earlier and only added for the last warm up. I did cook the chicken thighs (with bones that I later removed) from scratch. To ensure dumplings cooked I put under low pressure for 10 minutes at the end. Used dried parsley in the dumplings because that's all I had. Great recipe that I know I'll make again in lieu of chicken pot pie.
Love this recipe. I don't have marjoram so I just don't put that in. And instead of buttermilk, I used 1/2 cup milk and soured it it with a 1/2 tbsp of vinegar. Delicious!
I threw in macaroni with the peas and beans and bagged The dumplings. It was delicious.
It was delicious, but really, really thick. Next time Iâ€™ll use more liquid.
The whole family loved it, itâ€™s a keeper in my book!

Great recipe for dumplings, or as a pot pie filling. Milk worked fine instead of buttermilk. I pretty much stuck to recipe without any other changes. Delicious and I can't wait to make this recipe again!

This is a great recipe. However, I had to make a few adjustments. First, I cooked my chicken in a separate pot then added it to the instant pot with all the ingredients. I had to set my instant pot to pressure cooker for an additional 15mins due to my dumplings being too gooey on slow cook for 10 minutes. I didn't substitute any of the ingredients and once all done this is the home cooked meal I've been craving during my pregnancy. Thanks for the recipe!!
added leftover corn instead of green beans. and cut refrigerated biscuits into the broth base as dumplings.
Good but not outstanding.

I made this recipe exactly as called for, and there's just something about these ingredients that tastes better than the run of the mill chicken soup or pot pie filling. The only thing I would change is to make more dumplings! Not sure how I'd cook the extra but I'd figure out a way. I live by myself and this fed me for a week. Delicious! Thank you for sharing this! r-

This was really good! Family loved it and said it is a definite keeper. Some changes I made: used boneless chicken breast, cut up into cubes. Therefore, did not cook, remove, shred. I just skipped that step and continued with recipe from there. Also, I did not add the extra vegetables. We prefer only the onions, celery and carrots, which I increased a little. Other than that, I followed the recipe and there were zero leftovers.
Delicious!

This recipe showed up on my feed and of course I had to make it. My husband and I adjusted a few of the ingredients. We use the instant pot all the time and Iâ€™m always impressed by how easy and tasteful things are in it. We didnâ€™t have buttermilk so I used regular milk. Substituted edemame for the green beans and peas, used a can of cream of chicken soup and a cup less chicken broth. Love it, weâ€™ll make this again.
It is a new family fav. We ate it all with no leftovers. I did use Bisquick instead of making them from scratch and I left out the butter with flour mixture. It was still so good.
Wonderful dish full of flavor.

Outstanding family loved it made it twice now!!!I have made this so many times now my family loves it I added a couple things to it this last time of my own and BAM!! They love it even more thank you for a amazing RECIPE
Very delicious sauce And the chicken was amazingly tender. I didnâ€™t use all of the buttermilk because the dumpling would have been more sloppy than for my taste.

As mentioned by other reviewers, the broth is tasty! I probably would've given this recipe a 5 star if the dumplings came out a little more solid. My daughter thought they were very soft potatoes. They did have a very good flavor though! I will make it again, but might experiment with different dumpling recipes.

the soup came out amazing. the issue I have is the fact that there are ingredients in the recipe that aren't on the list and there is no measurement for it such as buttermilk and parsley. there were 4 items not listed in the ingredients. I had to guess on the buttermilk and I made my own since I wasn't aware I needed any. i used about 1/4 cup of milk with a small splash of vinegar to sour the milk.
The flavor is amazing! The dumplings melted out flat in the last step- not sure why, my fault Iâ€™m sure! But the flavor is perfect and Iâ€™d totally make it again.

I made this again for dinner last nightâ€”perfect comfort food for wintry weather. The vegetables don't need to be finely diced; I just do a rough chop, since the pressure cooker ensures they'll be tender. I also added chunks of potatoes because I had a couple to use up. The flour-butter paste at the end is to thicken the broth and to add richness. Oh, and if you don't have buttermilk, regular milk is fine for the dumplings. I made this last batch using my stovetop pressure cooker, which is big enough for a 1.5x amount of dumplings. For the bigger batch, I just added more flour and buttermilk but kept the salt, baking powder, and butter amounts the same.
